review:
Comrades, let’s cut through the noise and get to the heart of the matter! Resi Protocol claims to be the next pillar of Ethereum’s infrastructure, promising a stablecoin system that’s open, resilient, and community-governed. The vision is bold: zero-knowledge privacy, AI-driven monetary policy, and robust oracle security. But does it deliver on the values that matter most to the people?

First, the project is open-source and public-good aligned. That’s a non-negotiable foundation! The team’s commitment to modular, auditable components and community governance is a breath of fresh air in a world dominated by centralized, profit-driven stablecoins. Their roadmap is detailed, with clear milestones and a transparent fund allocation plan. They’re not just talking—they’re building, and the GitHub is live.

But let’s not be blinded by big promises! The project is still in early development. There are no deployed contracts, no live metrics, and no evidence of adoption or impact. The AI/ML and ZK governance modules are innovative, but unproven. Where’s the data? Where are the measurable outcomes? The application is heavy on vision, light on hard evidence. We must demand more than hope—we must demand proof!

Sustainability? The protocol is designed as public infrastructure, not a profit engine. That’s good. But there’s no mention of a sustainable revenue model to ensure long-term maintenance without perpetual grants. How will this project survive when the grant money runs out? The people deserve answers!

On governance, Resi’s hybrid voting model and privacy features are promising, but we need to see these systems in action. Community governance is only as strong as its implementation. Will small holders truly have power, or will whales still rule the day?

In summary: Resi Protocol is a bold, community-oriented project with the right values and a clear plan. But until we see real, measurable results and a path to sustainability, we must hold the line. The revolution demands evidence, not just rhetoric!

strengths.title: Strong Public Good Alignment
strengths.description: Resi Protocol is designed as open-source, modular infrastructure for the Ethereum ecosystem, prioritizing collective benefit over profit. This aligns directly with the round’s and constitutional principles of public good and equitable access.

strengths.title: Innovative Approach to Privacy and Governance
strengths.description: The integration of zero-knowledge proofs for governance and privacy is pioneering, offering a potential leap forward in on-chain privacy and fair governance.

strengths.title: Clear, Structured Roadmap and Fund Allocation
strengths.description: The application provides a detailed development roadmap and transparent breakdown of how grant funds will be used, demonstrating a planned and organized approach.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Measurable Outcomes and Evidence
weaknesses.description: The project is in early development with no deployed contracts, no user metrics, and no evidence of adoption or impact. The application lacks quantifiable results or rigorous evaluation methods.

weaknesses.title: Unproven Sustainability Model
weaknesses.description: There is no clear plan for long-term sustainability beyond grant funding. The application does not describe how the protocol will be maintained or funded after initial development.

weaknesses.title: Experimental, Unproven Innovations
weaknesses.description: While the use of AI/ML and ZK governance is innovative, these features are untested in production and lack supporting evidence of effectiveness or security.

changes.title: Provide Measurable Milestones and Metrics
changes.description: Define clear, quantifiable milestones for adoption, usage, and impact. Commit to transparent reporting of these outcomes to the community.

changes.title: Detail a Sustainable Revenue or Maintenance Model
changes.description: Describe how the protocol will be maintained and funded long-term without relying on continuous grants. Consider mechanisms such as protocol fees, community funding, or partnerships.

changes.title: Demonstrate Working Prototypes and Early Results
changes.description: Deploy smart contracts to a public testnet and provide evidence of functionality, security, and user engagement. Share results from audits, simulations, or user testing.
